solution_line_template: He needs {cans_per_layer_cake} can of frosting per layer cake and he needs to make {num_layer_cakes} layer cakes so that's {cans_per_layer_cake}*{num_layer_cakes} = <<{cans_per_layer_cake}*{num_layer_cakes}={frosting_for_layer_cakes}>>{frosting_for_layer_cakes} cans of frosting

There are {num_cupcake_dozens} dozen cupcakes,{num_single_cakes} single cakes and {num_brownie_pans} pans of brownies for a total of {num_cupcake_dozens}+{num_single_cakes}+{num_brownie_pans} = <<{num_cupcake_dozens}+{num_single_cakes}+{num_brownie_pans}={total_other_orders}>>{total_other_orders} orders

Each of the {total_other_orders} orders needs 1/2 can of frosting so they need {total_other_orders}*{frosting_per_other_order} = <<{total_other_orders}*{frosting_per_other_order}={frosting_for_other_items}>>{frosting_for_other_items} cans of frosting

He needs {frosting_for_layer_cakes} cans of frosting for the layer cakes and {frosting_for_other_items} cans for the remaining items for a total of {frosting_for_layer_cakes}+{frosting_for_other_items} = <<{frosting_for_layer_cakes}+{frosting_for_other_items}={total_frosting_cans}>>{total_frosting_cans} cans of frosting
